title: JavaScript
description: I feel very comfortable with JS even though I still have much to learn! Throughout my first 6 months at Chas Academy, I've only been coding 100% vanilla, which as given me a better understanding of the syntax and the appropriate use of function/code blocks in a more modular and optimized way.

title: TypeScript
description: I really prefer TS over JS for the readability! As a coding newbie, it helped me a lot to better understand and read the code without many comments or assistance online. My group project 'Quire' was coded 100% in TS vanilla and was very benefitial for me personally.

title: Java
description: I feel quite comfortable with Java, though I am not an expert. It was my very fist introduction to development, and the reason I fell in love with coding!

title: Git
description: I feel very comfortable using Git, especially Git Bash in an external terminal. My understanding is that internal terminals with additional help functions (such as the one in VS Code) are always changing and you can risk getting too used to one that can change any day! Through group projects I have become quite good at solving merging conflicts and safely creating feature branches to keep the main branch clean.

title: GitHub
description: Github has become like a second home! Very user friendly and excellent for merging branches, performing code reviews and getting an overview or details about a project.

title: Figma
description: Though I am still at a beginners level, I really enjoy using Figma! In fact, this website was first designed as a mock-up for my very first assignment in my UX course. Developing it further in to a real website was not mandatory, but I did it for the experience and had a lot of fun doing it!

title: HTML
description: HTML is a web developer's bread and butter. I feel very comfortable creating structures.

title: CSS
description: CSS has endless possiblities and for every new project I learn at least 20 new things and properties! I feel I'm getting better and better at designing my websites to be responsive, accessable, edgy and consistent.
